etymology.description: 禾(禾) (hé, "plant") + 又(又) (yòu, "hand") = a hand holding a plant by the stalk -> handle
etymology.interpretation: The character illustrates the action of grasping the stalk of a plant, symbolizing the concept of handling or controlling something. This makes sense given the components, as the hand is directly interacting with the plant.

examples.chinese: 他秉持正义(他秉持正義)，处理事务(處理事務)。
examples.english: He upholds justice and handles affairs.

examples.chinese: 总经理秉公用权(總經理秉公用權)，促使企业稳步发展(促使企業穩步發展)。
examples.pinyin: Zǒngjīnglǐ bǐnggōng yòngquán, cùshǐ qǐyè wěnbù fāzhǎn.
examples.english: The CEO handles power impartially, facilitating the steady growth of the enterprise.
